edu.txstate.hearts.utils

Class ProbabilityUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.txstate.hearts.utils.ProbabilityUtils

  • public abstract class ProbabilityUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    This class can be used for various probability gathering functions that might be used by any agent. In practice, I think only AgentAggressive is using any of this
    Author:
    Neil Stickels

      • getProbabilityEveryoneHasOneOfASuit

        public static double getProbabilityEveryoneHasOneOfASuit(Card.Suit suit,
                                         java.util.List<Card> hand,
                                         java.util.Set<Card> muck)
        Determine the probability that everyone has at least one card of the specified suit
        Parameters:
        suit - the suit being queried
        hand - the hand of the user making the request
        muck - all of the cards that have already been played
        Returns:
        a probability between 0 and 1 that everyone has at least one card in that suit

      • getTotalCardCombinationsWithForSuitAtLeastOne

        public static long getTotalCardCombinationsWithForSuitAtLeastOne(Card.Suit suit,
                                                 java.util.List<Card> hand,
                                                 java.util.Set<Card> muck)
        Similar to getTotalCombinationsForSuit, but with the caveat that it is only counting combinations in which each player has at least one card of the Suit in question.
        Parameters:
        suit - the Suit you are checking
        hand - your hand
        muck - all of the cards already played
        Returns:
        the number of ways the cards could legally be distributed in which each player has at least one card of the specified suit

      • getTotalCardCombinationsForSuit

        public static long getTotalCardCombinationsForSuit(Card.Suit suit,
                                   java.util.List<Card> hand,
                                   java.util.Set<Card> muck)
        Determines how many different wants the cards of a given suit could legally be distributed among the rest of the players. Legally being key here, because of the rules of Hearts, at the start of any given turn, everyone should have the same number of Cards in their hand, and it would not be possible to have more cards than that size. The algorithm uses a player's hand and all of the Cards that have already been played to determine how many cards of that suit are available. The algorithm will then determine all of the legal ways that those cards could be distributed between the other three players and return that number of combinations.
        Parameters:
        suit - the Suit in question
        hand - the hand of the Player calling the function (used to exclude cards available for other players)
        muck - all of the cards already played
        Returns:
        the number of ways the cards could legally be distributed

      • getProbabilityNoneOfSuitAndHasHearts

        public static double getProbabilityNoneOfSuitAndHasHearts(java.util.List<Card> hand,
                                          Card.Suit suit,
                                          java.util.Set<Card> muck,
                                          java.util.List<Card> cardsPlayedThisTurn,
                                          java.util.List<java.util.Set<Card>> knownCards,
                                          java.util.List<java.util.Set<Card.Suit>> knownEmpties,
                                          boolean qosPlayed)
        Determines the probability that one of the players does not have any cards in the suit in question and that that player also has hearts which could be played. The probability that someone does not have the suit the agent wants to play and does have hearts can be used to determine if that suit should be played. The function will determine how many cards of each suit are available (i.e., not in this player's hand and not already played) and then determine every combination of ways that these cards could legally be spread across all of the other players. Additionally, it will count the number of those combinations in which one player has no cards of that suit and has hearts. The probability returned is: the number of combinations without cards in the suit and with hearts -------------------------------------------------------------------- the total number of combinations
        Parameters:
        hand - the Player's hand
        suit - the Suit the Player is determining the probability for
        muck - the Cards that have already been played in the entire game
        cardsPlayedThisTurn - a List of Cards that have already been played this turn
        knownCards - a list of three Sets of known cards for opponents
        knownEmpties - a List of three Sets, with each set being known suits that a player does not have any cards in
        qosPlayed - a boolean indicator of whether or not the Queen of Spades has already been played in this game, if not, this algorithm will count the Queen of Spades as a heart
        Returns:
        probability another player does not have the suit in question and does have hearts
